Robin Wiltse Feltworks
View Similar: culture

Related Articles

  • yeah a teaser!

 Robin Wiltse works out of her Kaslo studio on the top floor of the Langham Cultural Centre where she has a stunning view of Kootenay Lake. Originally from the hamlet of Black Creek on Vancouver Island, Robin moved inland to study fibre arts at Nelson’s Kootenay School of the Arts. In Nelson she discovered a new medium and a new love, felting.

The glowing, wet colour inherent in wielding paint with a brush (her first love) is transmuted softly but with authority in her felted works. Hers is a painterly sensibility; the dyed fibres of wool her palette. 

Her subjects are inspired by the natural world, a source of color and light, design and pattern.

Contact Information
